org.sd.crawl
Class CrawlCache

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.crawl.CrawlCache

public class CrawlCache
extends java.lang.Object

Abstraction for caching crawled pages.

Author:
Spence Koehler

Method Detail

getInstance

public static final CrawlCache getInstance(java.io.File cacheDir)

closeInstance

public static final void closeInstance(java.io.File cacheDir)
Close the instance associated with the given cache dir (if it is open).

rollSubdir

public java.lang.String rollSubdir()
Roll over to the next subdir so that unretrievable pages will be cached in a fresh subdirectory.

Returns:
the name of the new subdir (within cacheDir).

retrieveCachedPage

public CrawledPage retrieveCachedPage(java.lang.String url,
                                      long forceRefreshTime)
Retrieve the page in this cache corresponding to the given url unless it is older (crawled longer ago) than the forceRefreshTime (magnitude).

If the page is not cached or too old, return null without deleting the page. Let the page be overwritten if the consumer chooses to recrawl and re-cache the page.

storePageInCache

public void storePageInCache(CrawledPage crawledPage,
                             java.lang.String originalContent)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Store the page in this cache, overwriting any existing.

If originalContent is null, write the "processed" content from the crawledPage; otherwise, write the originalContent.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeMetaData

public boolean writeMetaData(CrawledPage crawledPage)
Update the page's meta data in the cache map.

Returns:
true if the meta data was updated, which only happens when there is a difference; otherwise, false.

close

public void close()
Close this cache.
